/cvmfs/atlas.cern.ch/repo/sw/ASG/AnalysisBase/2.4.30/ParticleJetTools/ParticleJetTools/JetFlavourInfo.h

00001 #include "xAODJet/Jet.h"
00002 
00003 namespace xAOD {
00004 
00005   // return a "basic" jet flavour label:
00006   //    5:             b jet
00007   //    4:             c jet
00008   //   15:           tau jet
00009   //    0: light-flavour jet
00010   //
00011   // The first three different methods all use ghost association and correspond to the
00012   // different labeling schemes:
00013   // using the weakly decaying hadrons, using the hadrons resulting from fragmentation,
00014   // or using the partons just before fragmentation
00015 
00016   int GAFinalHadronFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00017   int GAInitialHadronFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00018   int GAFinalPartonFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00019 
00020   // The following methods use the "traditional" (Run-1) cone-based labelling and a "safer" successor
00021   // (safer because it uses hadrons, and becauses it uses an exclusive labelling -- it will associate
00022   // a HF hadron only with a single jet)
00023 
00024   int ConeFinalPartonFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00025   int ExclusiveConeHadronFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00026   int ExclusiveConeDoubleHadronFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet);
00027 
00028   enum JetFlavourLabelType { GAFinalHadron, GAInitialHadron, GAFinalParton, ConeFinalParton, ExclConeHadron, ExclConeDoubleHadron };
00029 
00030   // Provide a unified interface to all methods
00031   int jetFlavourLabel (const xAOD::Jet* jet, JetFlavourLabelType = ExclConeHadron);
00032   
00033 }
